Riksidrottsförbundet har 72 medlemsförbund (specialidrottsförbund, SF) som tillsammans har cirka 19 000 idrottsföreningar och totalt samlar idrottsrörelsen cirka 3,3 miljoner medlemmar vilket innebär ett stort antal användare av förbundets digitala verktyg. Du kommer ett ingå i ett team om fyra personer samt din närmsta chef och ni jobbar tillsammans främst med driften av idrottens administrativa verksamhetssystem IdrottOnline, en integrationsplattform, Microsoft 365 samt den infrastruktur som krävs för den digitala arbetsplatsen. Dina kollegor finns på två olika arbetsplatser - Idrottens Hus vid Skanstull och Bosön på Lidingö. Arbete kan förekomma på bägge arbetsplatserna men du kommer främst att spendera din arbetstid på kontoret i Skanstull.
 


  


  

**Några ord från din framtida närmsta chef:**



  


 Hej, Jag heter Victoria och är IT-chef på Sveriges Riksidrottsförbund och SISU Idrottsutbildarna. När jag började här för drygt 2 år sedan möttes jag av en otroligt välkomnande och trevlig arbetsplats där alla arbetar för visionen Svensk idrott världens bästa. Digitaliseringen går snabbt och för att trivas här måste man vara lösningsfokuserad och inspireras av nya utmaningar. Inom verksamhetsområdet IT och Digital utveckling arbetar vi i nära samarbete med varandra vilket skapar en bra sammanhållning där vi både utvecklar och stöttar varandra i det dagliga arbetet och dess utmaningar. Som ledare är mitt mål att coacha och stötta mina medarbetare i att utmana sig själva och att utvecklas. Jag kommer att finnas där som bollplank för alla typer av frågor, från stöd i övergripande tekniska beslut till att hitta nya sätt att lösa utmaningar.
   

 Ta chansen och bli en del av vårt härliga team där vi tillsammans gör allt för att stötta hela Sveriges idrottsrörelse!
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Arbete i en roll där du får jobba brett med olika uppgifter inom IT-drift
  
* Arbete i organisation där det händer mycket och som är under snabb utveckling vilket vi tror kommer ge dig goda möjligheter att utvecklas i din roll
  
* En välkomnande arbetsgivare som värnar om trivsel och välmående på arbetat genom att erbjuda möjligheten till tre dagars arbete på kontor och två dagars på distans per vecka (om arbetet tillåter), 2 timmars friskvård i veckan, 3000 kr i friskvårdsbidrag per år samt lunchförmåner. Här finns också en trivselgrupp vars uppgift är att skapar det där lilla extra sociala i vardagen på jobbet!
  


  


  

**Arbetsuppgifter**



  


 Du kommer huvudsakligen jobba med att hantera driften av IT-miljön vilket innebär övervakning, installation, uppgradering, konfigurering, utveckling samt optimering av infrastrukturen för IdrottOnline, integrationsplattformen samt Microsoft 365. Detta är en roll för dig och som vill jobba brett och lära dig nya tekniker och arbetssätt. Du kommer framförallt att jobba med drift av Windowsservrar men Riksidrottsförbundet jobbar utöver det bland annat med Linux, Cisco, Meraki, Docker, Kubernetes, Prometheus, Terraform, Gravitee, ArgoCD, Curity, Microsoft Dynamics 365 m.fl. och är det områden du inte kan sedan innan så är det något du kommer få utvecklas och lära dig mer inom här!
   




**Vi söker dig som**

 I denna rekrytering kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och intresse för tjänsten och Riksidrottsförbundet som organisation. Vi ser att du är duktig på att samarbeta, du gillar att tänka nytt och att utveckla dig själv och att ta ansvar för såväl din egen utveckling som det gemensamma resultatet i teamet.
 


  


  

**Vidare har du…**



  

  
* Minst några års erfarenhet av drift, underhåll, konfigurering och felsökning av system och nätverk
  
* Kunskaper inom Windows Server
  
* Kunskaper inom Microsoft Azure
  
* Kunskaper inom DevOps
  
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska då det är det primära arbetsspråket
  


  


  

**Vi ser det som meriterande om du också har…**



  

  
* Kunskaper inom Kubernetes
  
* Kunskaper inom SQL
  
* Kunskaper inom Microsoft 365
  


  


  

**Rekryteringsprocessen**



  

  
* Telefonintervju med Academic Work
  
* Problem- och personlighetstester
  
* Djupintervju med Academic Work
  
* Intervjuer med Riksidrottsförbundet
  
* Referenstagning + beslut
  


  


  

**Övrig information**



  

  
* Placering: Skanstull, möjlighet till visst distansarbete
  
* Start: Enligt överenskommelse
  
* Omfattning: Heltid
  
* Kontaktuppgifter: Ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Johanna Sörell, johanna.sorell@academicwork.se
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Sveriges Riksidrottsförbund**

 Läs mer om Riksidrottsförbundet på deras hemsida !
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Sveriges Riksidrottsförbund**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Johanna Sörell eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15106090

title: Team manager R&D - Data driven applications
description:
**Work at the heart of the Industry 5.0 transformation – the integration of artificial intelligence, robotics and the human factors of manufacturing - as manager for a new R&D team!**
 Our systems empower industry users to manage the configuration of our products in one powerful application. The aim is to continue strengthen production sites across the world with innovative solutions for resilient and sustainable industrial production.
   

  

**The role**
 You lead one of two cross functional teams with approximately 16 engineers developing software focusing on production data, traceability and analytics. Your team develops cloud SaaS solutions and on-prem software with web and app customer user interfaces. This is done in close cooperation with Marketing and other R&D teams with the aim to develop customer centric solutions.
   

 In addition to leading your team, you work with technology roadmaps, research and technology activities, cyber security and process development. You are part of steering groups and the Quality Critical Software department's management team.
   

 Some job areas:
   

  

* Create a learning and motivating environment and make people grow
* Meet our society's need of strengthened cyber security
* Be a stakeholder in the SAFe process
* Continuously improve our development process and collaborations


**City:** 
 Nacka, Stockholm. We have a hybrid work situation.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You have a technical academic degree within Computer Science, or other relevant area, and experience from leading software teams as a project or team manager.
   

 You have experience working within the SAFe framework and with product development processes. Experience from working with Inclusion & Diversity is a plus. Good communication skills and a genuine interest in leadership are essential. You are engaging and have a strategy for creating an open working climate.
   

  

**We offer you**
 At Atlas Copco, we foster a friendly atmosphere and uphold a culture of respectful interaction and ethical behavior. We value individuals who bring their authentic selves to work, contributing to our collective success. As pioneers in the industry, we’re passionate about driving dynamic change and empowering manufacturing customers.
   

 You are welcome to contact recruiting manager Joakim Gustafsson, [email protected] , if you have further questions. We are looking forward to your application via our jobsite!
   

  

 As part of the selection process, Atlas Copco Industrial Technique AB may perform a background check on final candidates.
   

  

**Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice**
 Bright ideas come from all of us. The more unique perspectives we embrace, the more innovative we are. Together we build a culture where difference is valued and we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging.

title: Senior Cybersecurity Architect, Connected Experience
description:
**Create moments that matter. Decode the future.**
 At the Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!
   

  

**All about the role:**
 As software is playing an increasingly significant role in enabling digital consumer experiences, we are gearing up to become more agile, faster in responding to market demands and quicker in identifying new market opportunities. This involves elevating our appliances to digital, software-defined products in a seamless integration of mobile apps, connectivity platform and a connected appliance.
   

  

**We’re looking for a Senior Cybersecurity Architect, Connected Experience, to join us on our journey.**
**What you'll do:**
 Contribute to defining secure architecture of Electrolux Connected Experience, with focus on mobile applications (Android and iOS platforms) and supporting systems; formulate and evangelize long-term cybersecurity and privacy strategy in the Connected Experience domain.
   

  

**In detail, you will:**
* Formulate and assure application of cybersecurity and privacy guardrails and best practices in software development within the Digital Experience Platform and the Connected Experience Domain; including hands-on cybersecurity review of Android and/or iOS solution and supporting tools, systems and processes;
* Carry out cybersecurity reviews and propose architecture improvements, ensure Security by design working together with other Architects, Engineers, Developers and Product Managers;
* Identify and communicate current and emerging Cybersecurity threats and Cybersecurity and Privacy gaps in existing and proposed architectures, recommend remedies or enhancements; ensure compliance to standards, policies and best practices;
* Engage with Cybersecurity stakeholders in formulation of long-term cybersecurity and privacy strategy in the domain of Connected Experience; track, evangelize and promote cybersecurity best practices.


**Who you are:**
* You must have strong understanding of core cybersecurity principles, IoT-systems architecture and common operating systems.
* You have deep hands-on experience with Android and/or iOS platforms, their cybersecurity and privacy aspects (e.g. application identity, ownership and release process) and their interconnection with Cloud APIs and backends;
* You have an understanding of methods of access control (e.g. RBAC, principle of least privilege), isolation (e.g. virtualization, containerization), cryptographic primitives and their use, as well as of the secure development lifecycle.
* Expertise is necessary in some of the advanced cybersecurity and privacy topics: data protection at rest and in transit; identity and access management; security threat modelling and risk assessment; cybersecurity testing; cybersecurity and privacy best-practices and regulations (OWASP, NIST, RED).
* Knowledge or experience in the area of security of Voice applications, BLE, Over-the-Air Updates or social logins is an advantage.
* Experience with Agile development methods and tools such as Atlassian SaaS an advantage; you are familiar with Continuous integration tools (Jenkins, CircleCI). Experience with Kotlin and other emerging mobile programming languages is an advantage.
* 5+ years of experience in cybersecurity aspects of digital product development; Master's Degree in Computer Science or Electronic Engineering, or comparable experience. PhD and/or cybersecurity specialization, is a plus.


**You demonstrate:**
* Collaboration - contributes to a highly collaborative environment that enables a cross functional team to flourish.
* Communication - effectively exchanges information and ideas with confidence and respect, able to demonstrate progress, raise issues and articulate changes on a frequent basis.
* Empathy - can understand and acknowledge the emotions and perspectives of others during conversations.
* Problem-Solving - able to connect the dots between insights, strategy, and conceptual direction; is outcome - as opposed to task - orientated.
* Adaptability & Resilience - can effectively navigate change, challenges, and setbacks while maintaining a positive and flexible approach.
* Proactivity - eager to learn and grow, sees challenges as opportunities, seeks and - is responsive to - feedback.
* Responsibility - accountable, reliable, and proactive in building systems and handling dependencies, contributing to a trustworthy and effective team dynamic.


**Where you'll be:**
 This is a full-time position, based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm/Stadshagen (Sweden). We may also consider exceptional candidates for Warsaw (Poland), Porcia/Forli (Italy) or Prague (Czech Republic).
   

  

 At our Global Headquarters in Stockholm/Stadshagen (Sweden) we are 60+ nationalities under the same roof and we enjoy the look and feel of the office!
   

  

 Regardless of the chosen location, you will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
   

  

 Benefits highlights:
   

  

* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family friendly benefits
* Insurance policy plan
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path


 As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.
   

  

**Find out more on:**
 ElectroluxGroup: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/lifeatelectrolux

title: Junior SAP Data Consultant
description:
Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all of these services. With our thought leadership and culture of innovation, we apply industry expertise, diverse skill sets and next-generation technology to each business challenge.
   

  

 We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity. Year after year, Accenture is recognized worldwide not just for business performance but for inclusion and diversity too.
   

  

 “Across the globe, one thing is universally true of the people of Accenture: We care deeply about what we do and the impact we have with our clients and with the communities in which we work and live. It is personal to all of us.” –
 **Julie Sweet, Accenture CEO.**
**About our Nordic SAP Business Group:**
 Accenture and SAP have a longstanding relationship that extends more than 40 years. As the leading Nordic SAP transformation partner, we work with SAP end-to-end from product innovation to development and delivery. Together, we are revolutionizing the future of business through major SAP transformation programs with some of the biggest companies.
   

  

 Within our Nordic SAP community, we work with the newest SAP solutions and offerings such as SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, SAP CX, Ariba, SuccessFactors, SAP BTP and SAP RISE.
   

  

 We are now looking to expand our community at scale and are looking for candidates on several positions and seniority levels.
   

  

 To read more about our SAP Practice, visit us at https://www.accenture.com/us-en/services/sap-index
   

  

**SAP Data Nordic Value Tower:**
 Within the SAP Value Tower Data, we offer you the opportunity to work with SAP Data and to grow your knowledge within the area of Information Management, connected to SAP MDG, Master Data Management and Data Migration.
   

  

 We are looking for people who have a genuine interest in Data, want to grow and challenge themselves within that area and work with the best skilled colleagues.
   

  

**Role Overview:**
 As a junior SAP Data Consultant in Accenture’s Nordic SAP Business Group, you will be an integral part of our team supporting our clients SAP transformation projects through acting as a Functional Expert in the Data Migration and/or Data Governance areas. You will work closely with clients, translating their business and functional requirements into SAP design documents and overseeing solution delivery.
   

  

**Example project roles:**
- Advise clients on their data transformation strategies, driving value creation through the positioning of SAP enabled solutions as well as leading solutions from SAP partners and Accenture

- Be part of the data migration stream of an S/4HANA transformation, working with colleagues in delivery centers to execute on their data transformation and data upload strategies

- Work with clients on their transformational journey, by implementing Master Data Governance strategy and processes, following SAP best practices and Accenture’s proven ways of working

**What’s in it for you:**
- Help Accenture deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity

- Be part of our culture and core values in a truly human work environment

- Take part in our highly engaged and diverse global network, for collaboration and delivery

- Enjoy competitive compensation and benefits

- Develop your skills and build an extraordinary career

- Grab significant development and training opportunities to develop your business acumen, consulting toolbox, technical and professional skills

- Get internal coaching, support and guidance from a mentor, to progress in your work and professional career with continuous feedback

- Gain access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization, including implementation methodologies, knowledge databases, industry leading add-on software, expert networks and benchmarks

- Combine business consulting skills with technology strategy know-how

- Transform businesses with the newest technologies and making them data-driven companies

- Work with some of the biggest SAP clients in large global implementation projects

- Be an integral part of innovative SAP transformation projects

- Play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world. Let there be change!

**Qualifications**
**Must have:**
- Deep interest in the importance of Data

- Passion about innovation and delivery of the latest technologies to your clients

- Strong resonance with Accenture’s values

- Motivation, persistence, eagerness to optimize and drive for excellence

- Strong analytical skills, result-oriented paired with highly structured working style and good sense of responsibility, flexibility and to be a team player

- Willingness and ability to quickly learn new concepts and technologies

- Eagerness to shape and work in a team-oriented environment

- Strong will to pursue a problem, identify the source and propose possible solutions in collaboration with other team members in a timely manner

- Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills to address technical and non-technical audiences in English

- Nordic (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish or Finnish) language spoken

- A Bachelor or Master’s degree

**Very nice to have:**
- Experience with Data Migration and/or Data Governance

- Previous exposure to or user of SAP

- Knowledge in a functional or business process area

- Technical development (programming) background

**Locations**
 Gothenburg, Malmö, Stockholm
   

  

 Thank you for your interest in joining Accenture. Due to the summer holiday season, our response times might be a bit longer than usual. Please note that we will review your application in the beginning of August and get back to you shortly after.

title: Cybersecurity Engineer, Compliance
description:
**Create moments that matter. Decode the future.**
 At the Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!
   

  

**All about the role:**
 As software is playing an increasingly significant role in enabling digital consumer experiences, we are gearing up to become more agile, faster in responding to market demands and quicker in identifying new market opportunities. This involves elevating our appliances to digital, software-defined products in a seamless integration of modular electronics, software, and connectivity platform.
   

  

**We’re looking for a Cybersecurity Compliance Engineer to join us on our journey.**
**What you'll do:**
 Ensure that Electrolux connected products and services adhere to all necessary cybersecurity compliance requirements. You will leverage your expertise to guide Digital Product teams, facilitating seamless communication with Information Security stakeholders and certification bodies. Your primary responsibilities include assisting in achieving and maintaining compliance with various regulations and certifications, as well as standardizing security practices across the organization.
   

  

**In detail, you will:**
* Develop Policies and Procedures: Create and maintain comprehensive security policies and procedures, support creation and maintenance of security compliance hub.
* Development Teams Support: Guide product teams on security best practices and compliance requirements.
* Regulatory Compliance: Serve as the primary contact for regulatory bodies and certification authorities within internal teams.
* Verification and Testing: Engage in adoption, implementation and automation of security compliance verification tools and methodology.
* Documentation: Maintain thorough documentation of compliance activities and audit findings.
* Continuous Improvement: Monitor and improve security processes and controls continuously.
* Experienced Engineer: Assist product teams in implementing security measures and understanding compliance requirements, including cloud security and application security.


**Who you are:**
* Knowledge: Deep understanding of information security principles, standards (ISO 27001, NIST, etc.), and regulatory requirements (ETSI 303645, RED, GDPR, CCPA, etc.).
* Expertise: Familiarity with relevant certifications (CISSP, CISM, CISA, etc.).
* Experience and/or expertise in software development, IoT engineering, security code review, security testing, secure development lifecycle, Agile development methods and tools such as Atlassian SaaS will be an advantage.
* Experience: Minimum of 3 years in cybersecurity, focusing on compliance and regulatory requirements.
* Education: Bachelor’s degree in computer science or Electronic Engineering, or comparable experience. Master’s Degree and/or cybersecurity specialization is a plus.


**You demonstrate:**
* Collaboration - contributes to a highly collaborative environment that enables a cross functional team to flourish.
* Communication - effectively exchanges information and ideas with confidence and respect, able to demonstrate progress, raise issues and articulate changes on a frequent basis.
* Empathy - can understand and acknowledge the emotions and perspectives of others during conversations.
* Problem-Solving - able to connect the dots between insights, strategy, and conceptual direction; is outcome - as opposed to task - orientated.
* Adaptability & Resilience - can effectively navigate change, challenges, and setbacks while maintaining a positive and flexible approach.
* Proactivity - eager to learn and grow, sees challenges as opportunities, seeks and - is responsive to - feedback.
* Responsibility - accountable, reliable, and proactive in building systems and handling dependencies, contributing to a trustworthy and effective team dynamic.


**Where you'll be:**
 This is a full-time position, with a preferred location in Warsaw, Poland. We may also consider exceptional candidates at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm (Sweden), Porcia/Forli (Italy) or Prague (Czech Republic).
   

  

 Regardless of the chosen location, you will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
   

  

**Benefits highlights:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family friendly benefits
* Insurance policy plan
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path


 As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.
   

  

**Find out more on:**
 ElectroluxGroup: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/lifeatelectrolux

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**Description**
 What makes us Qlik?
   

  

 A Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ Leader for 13 years in a row, Qlik transforms complex data landscapes into actionable insights, driving strategic business outcomes. Serving over 40,000 global customers, our portfolio leverages pervasive data quality and advanced AI/ML capabilities that lead to better decisions, faster.
   

  

 We excel in integration and governance solutions that work with diverse data sources, and our real-time analytics uncover hidden patterns, empowering teams to address complex challenges and seize new opportunities.
   

  

 The Senior Machine Learning Engineer Role
   

  

 Join Qlik as a Senior ML Engineer and be at the forefront of shaping the future of AI in the data and analytics field. Contribute to developing innovative AI products, solving complex challenges, and pioneering the responsible and ethical implementation of AI.
   

  

 What makes this role interesting?
   

  

 Diverse Use Cases: Design, develop, and maintain a set of AI products that address a diverse range of use cases, including predictive, generative, and classification scenarios.
   

  

 Collaborative Innovation: Collaborate with a dynamic team of data scientists, software engineers, and domain experts to create user-friendly AI solutions.
   

  

 Multicultural Environment: Be part of a multicultural and highly collaborative environment, contributing to a creative and team-oriented culture.
   

  

 Pioneering Integration: Pioneer the combination of structured and unstructured data, unlocking new use cases and hidden insights.
   

  

 Semantic Search Development: Build semantic search capabilities on our platform, translate natural language into analytic queries, and continuously improve AI responses based on user behaviour.
   

  

**Here’s How You’ll Be Making An Impact**
* Strategic Footprint: Directly influence the footprint of Qlik's AI products, contributing to a strategic investment in AI.
* User-Centric Solutions: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand user requirements and implement impactful and user-friendly AI solutions.
* Critical Functionality Delivery: Work with product design teams to deliver critical functionalities supporting our AI vision.
* Technology Evaluation: Identify and evaluate new technologies, enhancing the performance, maintainability, and reliability of our machine learning systems.
* Best Practices Application: Apply software engineering best practices, including CI/CD, automation, monitoring, and security.


**We’re Looking For a Teammate With**
* Master's or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
* 5+ years of experience building production-quality AI/ML software.
* Programming proficiency in languages like Python, Golang, Java, C++.
* Experience with structured data using popular machine learning libraries and frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
* Familiarity with foundational models like Llama, Falcon, OpenAI, Hugging Face, Mistral, etc.
* 3+ years of experience with cloud service providers (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
* Expertise in working with unstructured data sources, including RAG, vector databases, knowledge graphs, grounding, prompt engineering, chain-of-thought, pre-training, and fine-tuning.
* Familiarity with SQL programming and SQL/NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB, ElasticSearch).
* Demonstrated ability to stay abreast of emerging trends and techniques in the field of AI.


 The location for this role is:
   

  

 Sweden - Lund or Stockholm
   

  

 Join us at Qlik and shape the future of AI – your opportunity to make an impact is now!
   

  

**More About Qlik And Who We Are**
 Find out more about life at Qlik on social: @LifeAtQlik, LinkedIn, YouTube, and X/Twitter, and to see all other opportunities to join us + our values, check out www.qlik.com/careers
   

  

 What else do we offer?
   

  

* Genuine career progression pathways and mentoring programs
* Culture of innovation, technology, collaboration, and openness
* Flexible, diverse, and international work environment


 Giving back is a huge part of our culture. Alongside an extra “change the world” day plus another for personal development, we also highly encourage participation in our Corporate Responsibility Employee Programs
   

  

 If you need assistance applying for a role due to a disability, please submit your request via [email protected]. Any information you provide will be treated according to Qlik’s Recruitment Privacy Notice. Qlik may only respond to emails related to accommodation requests.
   

  

 Qlik is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Qlik via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Qlik. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Qlik as a result of the referral or through other means.
   

  

 - EMEA

title: System Engineer
description:
**Qamcom is growing and we are looking for talented Systems Engineers to join our Qamcom office in Stockholm!** 




  





 Qamcom Research and Technology is a dynamic hub of innovation, offering specialist consulting services and product development with an emphasis on intelligent, connected systems. Our expertise spans a wide range of areas including sensors and radars, image and signal processing, embedded HW and SW, multi-modal AI analytics, and wireless communication systems, as well as application software, edge-cloud infrastructure, and functional safety.
 



 Our team possesses the comprehensive skills necessary to develop complete products for serial production. We can take ownership of every aspect of the development chain from the initial design to the final product.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As a Senior Systems Engineer, you will join our team of experienced software and hardware engineers and algorithm specialists in our Stockholm office, playing a crucial role in ensuring that our solutions perform at the very edge of what is possible. You will be at the core of our projects, coordinating the teams’ technical solutions and working closely with all the team members.
 



 At Qamcom, we foster an inclusive environment where diverse talents come together. We are especially keen to welcome female engineers who want to help us build innovative technology.
 



  





**Your responsibilities will include:** 



* Taking ownership of the system design process, encouraging the team to develop modular solutions while keeping in check the individual conditions and requirements of every project.
* Being actively involved in the entire development process, including requirement definition and management, system design, development, prototyping, testing and industrialization.
* Working closely with our customers and partners to identify requirements and needs, define the product’s functionality, make various implementation choices, handle life cycle considerations and so forth.



  





**Qualifications** 




 We are looking for a systems engineer with modular thinking skills that wants to create sustainable solutions. This position could be for you if:
 


* You are used to working in an environment where you quickly need to familiarize yourself with unknown areas.
* You are curious and self-driven, with the ambition to constantly further your skills.
* You are able to work independently.
* You are able to both benefit from and contribute to a team of experienced and highly skilled colleagues.



  





 If that is you, you will fit perfectly into our role-based organization with cross-functional teams, which will give you a lot of flexibility and freedom. For this role, we require:
 


* 6 years of experience in Systems Engineering and/or Systems Architecture,
* Requirement and change management work,
* Understanding of CI/CD and of good coding practices,
* Experience in Systems Engineering within Software or Embedded Software Development,
* Experience in Systems Engineering within Digital Electronics,
* Experience in Systems Engineering within Hardware Design,
* Basic project management skills,
* Fluency in English,
* Swedish resident or Swedish work permit,



  





**Meriting** 




 Extra qualifications that we would consider helpful are:
 


* Experience in implementing computationally demanding software (e.g., AI algorithms or computational science),
* Hands-on experience with relevant industry standards in project requirements phase and implementation (e.g. functional safety standards or Medtech standards),
* Hands-on experience with cyber and/or information security, from threat and risk assessment to implementation and testing,
* Working proficiency in Swedish,



  





**Qamcom offers** 




 We are proud to offer a work environment with highly competent and experienced colleagues. We create teams with a unique blend of high academic competence and rich industry experience. In our in-house projects we often create cutting-edge system solutions that encompass hardware, software, and algorithms tailored for industrial and medtech applications. Hence, we provide the possibility to apply advanced technology in various product development projects focusing on a variety of business segments like medtech, industry 4.0 and Industrial IoT and AI.
 



 Additionally, a sample of general benefits are listed below:
 


* Competitive insurance and pension program.
* Generous parental leave (90% of the salary).
* Wellness policy (up to 5000 SEK/year).
* Leasing of a bicycle. Option for an employee car (electric or hybrid).



  





***Join us at Qamcom, where your expertise will contribute to shaping the future of technology and innovation***
*.*

title: Lead Snowflake Data Engineer
description:
**Assignment description** 




**We are looking for a Lead Snowflake Data Engineer for our client in the Financial Sector** 




 ﻿
 



**Scope:** 



* Lead development in building out a new data solution in Snowflake to support Recoveries & Loss business processes on Snowflake within AWS environment
* Lead efforts to integrate and curate data from multiple sources into a consolidated data mart on Snowflake
* Collaborate with Business and IT analysts in Technology to design and implement data models in Snowflake
* Set up CI/CD for ETL pipelines on Snowflake
* Design and implement data models and ETL pipelines. Optimize data pipelines for performance and scalability
* Adapt ETL pipelines to evolving data models and business needs and in response to data quality assurance findings



 ﻿
 



**Skills:** 



* Hands-on experience in implementation of cloud data warehouses using Snowflake
* Strong understanding of data warehousing and data modelling concepts. Data warehousing design experience and Kimball methodologies
* Experience with ETL pipeline development using Snowflake’s features
* Experience in setting up CI/CD for ETL pipelines in Snowflake
* Experience orchestrating ETL pipelines using Airflow
* Experience in creating models and writing transformation logic in DBT
* Experience in the banking domain will be a big plus



 ﻿
 



**Behaviour:** 



* Be a self-starter who takes autonomy and pride in your work
* Have the ability to think independently and under own initiative once the initial guidance is given
* Maintain great attention to detail
* Focus on overall product quality and build



  
 



**Start date:** 
 02/09/2024
 



**End date:** 
 31/12/2024
 



**Location:** 
 Copenhagen, Denmark
 



  
 



**Required skills** 




 Data warehousing design
 



 CI/CD for ETL pipelines in Snowflake
 



 Data Modelling
 



 Data Warehousing
 



 Snowflake
 



 Kimball methodologies
 








**Languages** 




 English (Proficient)

title: Cloud Engineer – Web Analytics and Marketing
description:
Do you want to be an enabler of web analytics and marketing serving Private Customers at If?
   

  

 The MarTech tribe at If P&C Insurance is advancing its capabilities in omni-channel, real-time and personalized customer communications. We are using Google Analytics 4, Google Cloud Platform and Azure services to enable web analytics and to provide tailored offers ensuring a the best personalized customer experience in the future.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Cloud Engineer, you will design and develop solutions on the Google Cloud Platform and in Microsoft Azure employing cutting edge technologies to build scalable and robust data solutions. Your role will be key in shaping our data practices, ensuring data accuracy and accessibility to facilitate our web behavioral action and analytics roadmap. You’ll join an easy-going Nordic team of developers who make this happen and have fun while doing it.
   

  

 You'll have a high degree of freedom together with your squad members in developing our web behavioral actioning and analytics data foundation to support customer communications and to source, transform and distribute data from Google Analytics 4 to Google Cloud and BigQuery and Databricks to support various use cases within web personalization, communication and marketing to customers needing insurance.
   

  

 You take pride in choosing the most appropriate services given the task and ensuring cost efficient solutions in GCP and Azure.
   

  

 We practice agile and DevOps in our day-to-day life. We pride ourselves in improving our Google Cloud and Azure solutions with sound engineering principles and Infrastructure as Code, CI/CD, high test coverage and proactive monitoring. We love Tech!
   

  

**We offer**
 In the same way that we place high expectations on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer. Here are some of the benefits of working at If:
   

  

* An including and highly skilled professional work environment where everyone is welcome
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
* Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
* Possibility of hybrid workplace
* Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
* Great insurance benefits
* Lunch benefit


**About The Team**
 We’re a diverse, Nordic team of highly motivated developers who are passionate about serving customers with timely, personalized communications to help them live a worry-free life and insure what is most dear to them. We work closely with business stakeholders like web development teams, web analysts and marketeers to make this happen.
   

  

 We promote continuous tech nurturing, certifications and learning including hackathons both within our team and together with our partners at Google, Microsoft and Salesforce. We love experimentation and constantly follow new technology to create better solutions.
   

  

 Who are you?
   

  

 You’re passionate about data engineering and data in Google Cloud and Microsoft Azure, have experience from a wide range of data technologies and storage including structured and unstructured data, streaming and real-time. You are experienced in ETL and managing mission critical data loadings, love data modelling and optimizing data efficiency and performance continuously.
   

  

 We believe you have experience in any of the following two stacks:
   

  

* Google Cloud Pub/Sub, BigQuery, Cloud Run and Cloud Functions for serverless application deployments, server-side tracking with Google Tag manager.
* Azure Functions, Databricks, Data Factory and Storage


 It’s a big bonus if you have experience working with Web development, Web personalization, Rest API, Google Analytics 4, Data privacy and security.
   

  

 You also have:
   

  

* A bachelor’s Degree (or higher) in Computer Science or Software engineering or equivalent experience
* Excellent English language and communication skills (oral and written)
* Previous experience with application and software development


**Additional Facts And Recruitment Process**
 Application deadline: Screening and interviewing will start immediately. Deadline to apply is August 26th 2024.
   

 To apply for the position: Please attach both CV and a personal letter.
   

 Work location: Turku, Finland or Stockholm, Sweden.
   

 Travelling: Some travelling in the Nordics is required for this position
   

 Start: As soon as possible by agreement
   

  

 Background checks will be done in accordance with the law in the country of employment.
   

  

 For more information: Contact Klas Sjögren, Nordic Head of CRM and Marketing solutions, klas.sjogren@if.se
   

  

**About Us**
  

***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.**
 To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.
   

  

 We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.
   

  

 Come and join us!*

title: Senior Full-Stack Developer (Python/React)
description:
**Senior Full-Stack Developer – Stockholm, Hybrid** 




 Are you passionate about building innovative software solutions for the energy sector in a consultancy environment? Want to play a key role in developing cutting-edge applications for a diverse client base, where you'll tackle complex data optimisation challenges and create impactful products across the full stack?
 



  





**What's in it for you?** 




 You'll join a dynamic team of software engineers and data scientists, specialising in custom product development for the energy industry. Your role will span both backend and frontend development (split about 80/20 towards the backend), allowing you to contribute across the entire stack.
 



  





 Enjoy a flexible hybrid work model, balancing office time in Stockholm with remote work. You'll engage in projects of various scales, collaborating with cross-functional teams and interfacing directly with clients to deliver tailored solutions.
 



  





 You’ll get a competitive salary offering up to 70,000 SEK per month (depending on your experience).They are committed to professional growth, with plans to offer clear paths to leadership roles as the company expands. With ambitious growth plans, there's potential for advancement to senior technical positions in the future. On top of this you’ll get 30 days vacation, a health and wellness allowance (friskvård) and private pension contribution.
 



  





**What you'd be doing?** 




 You'll typically work in agile teams of 5-6 people, sometimes scaling up for larger projects. You might spearhead new initiatives, assessing client needs and building your team from within the company.
 



  





 Your work will involve developing sophisticated data infrastructure, implementing machine learning components, and creating robust APIs. You'll use a modern tech stack including cloud services, containerisation, and message brokers.
 



  





 On the frontend, you'll craft user interfaces ranging from analytical dashboards to complex 3D visualisations, using cutting-edge web technologies to create responsive and data-rich applications.
 



  





**About you?** 




 You have at least 5 years of experience in full-stack development, with a strong backend focus, preferably in Python including frameworks such as FastAPI, Django, RabbitMQ & Kafka. On the frontend, they work with modern JavaScript frameworks such as React, so experience here would also be essential.
 



  





 You're passionate about clean, efficient code and stay current with emerging technologies. Adaptability is key, as you'll work across various domains and tech stacks.
 



 Experience with DevOps practices, cloud platforms and familiarity with data processing and machine learning tools is a plus.
 



  





 Consultant-style experience is beneficial, as client interaction is a significant part of the role and fluency in both Swedish and English is a must for effective client communication.
 



  





**A bit about them?** 




 A growing tech consultancy in Stockholm, specialising in software solutions for the energy sector. They partner with both established industry leaders and innovative startups, focusing on data-driven applications that promote sustainability.
 



  





 The company culture emphasises collaboration, continuous learning, and making a positive impact in the green tech space. They're seeking motivated individuals who can drive technical discussions and align with their mission to create meaningful solutions in the energy sector.
 



  





 With a current team of about 45 and plans for significant growth, this role offers an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of energy tech innovation in a rapidly expanding organization.
 



  





  





*Don't worry if your CV isn't up to date - just send me a message on LinkedIn or an email over to will@zebrapeople.com and we can go from there.* 




  





  





*3 stage Interview Process* 



1. *Initial Chat*
2. *Technical Discussion*
3. *Final with CEO*

title: Senior Salesforce Consultant
description:
Axenon is a Nordic Salesforce partner and a member of the North Alliance family, the Nordic region's largest agency network in design, technology and communication. Our mission is to empower organizations with tailored Salesforce solutions that align perfectly with our clients unique business processes, challenges, and objectives.
 



  





 As a Senior Salesforce Consultant, you will collaborate with Axenon's project managers within business development and the successful adoption and implementation of the Salesforce platform. This role requires a deep understanding of both the technical capabilities of Salesforce and the strategic objectives of the business, ensuring that the solutions devised are not only effective but also aligned with the broader goals of the organization.
 



  





**Additionally, you will** 



* Support business development activities.
* Identify customer needs by working with both internal and external teams.
* Engage in pre-sales discovery, documenting both business and functional requirements.
* Provide consulting to clients on cloud architecture.
* Lead business process review sessions to identify user stories/requirements and conceptualize solution designs based on best practices and client needs.
* Ensure optimal use and adherence to best practices across various clouds.
* Utilize standard Salesforce configuration to meet client requirements.
* Perform analysis, cleansing, and insertion of data.



  





**Our offer to you** 




 Joining Axenon, you become an integral part of a vibrant company of about fifty professionals, including project managers, Salesforce consultants, and developers. Our team comes from varied backgrounds and industries. Together, we meet challenges, create solutions and achieve digital changes that have a major and meaningful impact for our clients.
 



  





**In addition to excellent colleagues** 



* Enjoy the comfort and inspiration of working in a contemporary office located at Tulegatan , designed to foster creativity and collaboration.
* We invest in you from day one, offering personalized, fully-sponsored Salesforce certification programs to deepen your expertise and enhance your credentials.
* Your professional development is important. We provide a wide range of educational opportunities and resources within your field, ensuring you're always on the cutting edge and ready for the next step in your career.



  





**Who are you?** 




 We are seeking an individual who not only brings extensive experience in consultancy within relevant fields such as technical consultant or business analytics but also possesses a track record of successful engagements and a deep understanding of client needs in various industries.
 



  





**You probably recognize yourself in the following** 



* 5+ years' hands-on expertise in Salesforce implementations and configurations.
* Experience implementing several Salesforce Cloud solutions such as Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, or Marketing Cloud and understands their application to business needs.
* Good expertise in crafting Flows to automate processes within the Salesforce platform, along with a solid understanding of how to utilize APEX code to build triggers/batchers for internal or external processes interfacing with other systems’ APIs
* Proficient in articulating technical Salesforce solutions to non-technical stakeholders.
* Understand on a conceputal / process level how to utilize Visualforce, Lightning Components, and Salesforce APIs for custom development and integration
* Skilled in Salesforce data migration and data quality management, ensuring accuracy and integrity of data within Salesforce environments.
* University degree within a relevant IT field such as computer science or information technology.
* Proficient in Swedish.



  





**Next step** 




 You do not need to send a personal letter or CV document to apply. We want to make it easy for you to show your interest - so all we need is for you to enter a link to your Linkedin profile.

title: SAP Plant Maintenance and Utilities Consultant
description:
Accenture and SAP have a rich, 40-year history of collaboration, driving innovation and transformation in the business world. As the leading Nordic SAP transformation partner, our Nordic SAP Business Group is at the forefront of SAP technologies and solutions, such as SAP S/4HANA Cloud, SAP CX, Ariba, SuccessFactors, SAP BTP, and SAP RISE. We work closely with some of the biggest companies in the region, leading major SAP transformation programs that are revolutionizing the future of business.
   

  

 We are known for our technological expertise and functional knowledge in areas such as Supply Chain, Procurement, Finance, HR, Data Analytics in many industries including Energy and Utilities. We have a strong focus on sustainability, helping clients define and enable sustainability strategies while creating new sources of business value.
   

  

**The Role**
 We are currently expanding our Swedish SAP community and are seeking experienced SAP Plant Maintenance and Utilities Consultant in Sweden for various roles within the Energy sector.
   

  

 You will have a unique opportunity to work on projects critical to our client's success in the dynamic Energy industry.
   

  

**Qualifications required:**
- At least 2 years of SAP Plant Maintenance background, preferably with international technology companies or end-user clients within Utilities / Energy / Power Gen or related industries

- Good process understanding covering corrective, preventive and predictive maintenance

- A Bachelor or Master’s degree

- Based in Sweden, or willing to relocate (within EU)

- Swedish language skills

**Preferred Qualifications:**
- Experience in at least one S/4HANA Plant Maintenance implementation, ideally through full lifecycle (estimating, planning, delivering a solution end-to-end)

- Experience in SAP EAM portfolio

- SAP certification

- Deep business and industry experience in Energy industry

**Location**
 Stockholm, Malmo
   

  

  

  

**Why Join Accenture?** 
  

  

 Join Accenture and become part of a passionate team committed to technology, innovation, and personal growth. We are at the forefront of SAP innovation within the Life Sciences sector and are making a positive impact in the health industry.
   

  

  

- Professional Growth: Unlock significant career development opportunities with access to training, certifications, and a clear path for advancement.

- Inclusive Culture: Be part of a diverse and collaborative team in a work environment that values your contributions and well-being.

- Cutting-Edge Resources: Access the latest technology and tools to excel in your field while working on innovative projects.

  

  

 If you are excited to join our dynamic team and contribute to the world of SAP within the Utilities and Energy industry, we invite you to apply for your preferred position. Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and qualifications. Join us in shaping the future of business through SAP innovation and making a positive impact on the Energy transition.
   

  

 For more information about our SAP Practice, please visit us at https://www.accenture.com/se-en/services/sap-index

title: Client Manager - Advisory Sales (Mobility Sweden)
description:
Blocket är en del av Schibsted Marketplaces som inkluderar Blocket i Sverige, FINN i Norge, Oikotie och Tori i Finland och DBA och Bilbasen i Danmark. Vårt team sträcker sig över Norden och Polen, förenade i en gemensam passion för vårt arbete. Nyfikenhet, teamwork, problemlösning och kontinuerligt lärande är hörnstenarna i vår kultur.
   

  

 Just nu är Schibsted Marketplaces på en spännande resa för att bli ett företag med fullt fokus på marknadsplatser. Vårt uppdrag är att ge människor möjlighet att fatta kloka beslut för sig själva och för framtida generationer.
   

  

  

  

  

  

 ,
   

  

**Möjligheten i korthet**
**Du?** 
 Vi söker dig som är genuint intresserad av försäljning och har förmågan att leverera en förstklassig köpupplevelse till kunder. Du är nyfiken, engagerad, har flera års erfarenhet av B2B försäljning och är redo att ta ditt nästa steg till några av Nordens och Sveriges största marknadsplatser!
   

  

**Rollen?** 
 Som Client Manager har du budget- och tillväxtansvar för din kundportfölj som innehåller några av landets största bilåterförsäljare och generalagenter. Som en del av vårt Advisory Sales team säkerställer du strategisk och taktisk planering för givna kunder genom hela säljprocessen. Du har hög och proaktiv aktivitetsnivå och omsätter kunders utmaningar till relevanta och kvalitativa medielösningar.
   

  

**Läge?** 
 Vår hybridstrategi uppmuntrar dig att tillbringa några dagar i veckan på vårt moderna centrala Stockholms kontor, vilket främjar teamsamarbete och samhörighet. Om du föredrar en kontorsmiljö är du mer än välkommen att komma in dagligen.
   

  

**Bolag?**
 Blocket är Sveriges största och mest populära marknadsplats med cirka 12,3 miljoner aktiva användare varje månad som genererar 100 miljoner sessioner. Vi är stolta över vårt arbete med att öka begagnathandeln i Sverige och därmed bidra positivt till vår miljö. Sedan 2023 ingår även Blocket som ett av varumärkena inom Schibsted Nordic Marketplaces. Några av de andra framstående varumärkena är FINN och Nettbil i Norge, DBA och Bilbasen i Danmark samt Tori och Oikotie i Finland.
   

  

**Varför Vi?**
 Vill du representera några av Nordens ledande marknadsplatser och jobba med en innovativ och spännande produktportfölj? Vi söker nu en ny Client Manager till vårt Advisory Sales team inom Mobility på Blocket som ansvarar för några av landets största aktörer inom bilindustrin. Vi söker dig som har drivet, modet och nyfikenheten att bli en del av vårt framgångsrika säljteam på Blockets kontor i centrala Stockholm.
   

  

**Låter detta intressant? Läs gärna vidare!**
**Vem är du?**
 Vi tror att du har ett
 **nyfiket mindset** 
 , vill
 **lära dig** 
 nya saker och är
 **förändringsbenägen** 
 . Du har en hög
 **servicegrad** 
 , gillar att prata och
 **träffa kunder** 
 och har en
 **god samarbetsförmåga** 
 , både internt och externt. Du är
 **lösningsorienterad** 
 med en
 **stark målmedvetenhet** 
 och en
 **drivkraft att prestera på topp** 
 . Flytande i
 **svenska och engelska** 
 : medan de flesta av dina kunder kommer att vara svensktalande, är vårt företags språk engelska och vi samlar människor från olika bakgrunder
   

  

**Vad handlar jobbet om?**
 I denna roll ansvarar du för våra nyckelkunder och några av landets största bilåterförsäljare och generalagenter. Vårt mål är att alla kunder ska få ut maximal effekt av att synas i våra plattformar och detta är din främsta uppgift som Client Manager hos oss. Vi ser att du träffar kunder både fysiskt och digitalt flera gånger i veckan och även om rollen utgår från Stockholm förekommer resor i landet någon gång i kvartalet. Du trivs med att arbeta både mot enskilda och gemensamma mål och är en lagspelare som gillar att vinna tillsammans! Eftersom både fordons- och mediebranschen är i ständig förändring bör du vara förändringsbenägen och tycka att det är motiverande att arbeta mot en framtid som inte ännu är helt utstakad. Tidigare kunskap och erfarenhet från mediebranschen inklusive ett brett nätverk hos mediebyråer är ett stort plus och/eller erfarenhet från bilbranschen är meriterande men inte ett krav.
   

  

**Om teamet**
 Vi är ett starkt och sammansvetsat säljteam med flera års erfarenhet från mediabranschen och bilbranschen. Vi gillar att jobba mot högt uppsatta mål men samtidigt att ha kul på jobbet. Vi lär oss av varandra och är vana att arbeta i mindre kundteam med andra kollegor från våra avdelningar på Blocket samt i spännande och utvecklande projekt med våra nordiska kollegor inom Nordic Marketplaces.
   

  

**Förbättringsområden** 
 Allt är såklart inte en “dans på rosor” och branscherna vi är verksamma inom genomgår stora förändringar som kommer att fortsätta att ske över tid och vi har ännu inte svaret på alla frågor. Är du en person som tycker att detta låter spännande snarare än läskigt? Låt oss då träffas för att prata om vilka möjligheter det finns för just dig att vara med att påverka framtiden.
   

  

**Vi** 
**erbjuder** 
 En fantastisk arbetsplats med en livlig atmosfär där prestationer firas med entusiasm. Ditt välbefinnande är en prioritet, stöttat av företagets förmåner
 **inklusive pension, försäkringar och flexibla arbetstider** 
 . Njut av
 **30 semesterdagar** 
 per år samt halva arbetsdagar före helgdagar.
 **Hälsa** 
 är viktigt med ett
 **bidrag på 5 000 SEK och 2,5 betalda träningspass** 
 varje vecka. Återhämta dig med massage på plats och måndag frukost. Omfamna den
 **svenska fika-traditionen** 
 varje fredag för avslappning och gemenskap.
   

  

**Låter det spännande?**
 Om du letar efter en arbetsplats och roll där du kan dela med dig av din kunskap och expertis, lära dig och växa, bli inspirerad, vara dig själv och göra skillnad, låt oss höra från dig snarast. Vi värdesätter mångfald och välkomnar sökande från alla bakgrunder.
   

  

**Frågor?** 
 Låter det intressant? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag, då vi kommer att träffa intressanta kandidater kontinuerligt under hela ansökningstiden! Har du frågor om rollen kontakta Emelie Storsten Filling, emelie.storsten@schibsted.com
   

  

**Om Schibsted Marketplaces**
 FINN, Blocket, DBA, Bilbasen, Oikotie & Tori. Kände du igen några bekanta namn? Då vet du redan lite om Schibsted Nordic Marketplaces! Med 3700 kollegor i Norden och Polen delar vi en passion för vårt arbete och skapar en vänlig och omtänksam gemenskap. Nyfikenhet, teamwork, problemlösning och kontinuerligt lärande är grundpelarna i vår kultur.
   

  

 Vi påbörjar en spännande resa för att bli ett motståndskraftigt
 **marknadsplatsorienterat** 
 företag som håller samman 40+ varumärken som Blocket och Prisjakt. Vårt uppdrag är att ge människor möjligheten att göra kloka val för sig själva och kommande generationer, och därför handlar vår framtida riktning om att vara smidig och proaktiv i det snabbt föränderliga digitala landskapet – att forma framtiden för digitala marknadsplatser.
   

  

 Kolla in på LinkedIn & Instagram, och lär känna Schibsted Tech & Shetech Communities tillsammans med Schibsted Talks-podden som drivs av våra egna kollegor. Inkludering för oss betyder att skapa en rättvis arbetsplats där var och en av oss respekteras, firas för den vi är och ges lika möjligheter att blomstra. Ta en titt på vårt åtagande för mångfald, Inkludering & Tillhörighet på vår hållbarhets sida.

title: Senior .Net Developer
description:
**.NET Developer to Tech company in Täby, Stockholm** 

  





 Are you an experienced .NET developer eager to craft groundbreaking solutions? Do you want to work in a dynamic team of front- and backend developers who love staying updated with the latest technology? Is a work environment characterized by positivity, innovation and engagement something you value? If yes, StrongPoint is where you want to be!
 



  




 About the role:
 
 As a .Net developer at StrongPoint you will have the chance to work with the latest technology and develop your skills in a supportive and innovative environment. You will also have the possibility to contribute to creating advanced and efficient solutions to customers all over the world.
 


 Key responsibilities:
 * Drive technical projects both internally and with external clients.
* Take a leading role and act as a technical expert towards StrongPoints clients.
* Work with our latest and most modern cloud solution, including both front- and backend development.


 Who are we looking for?
 
 To be successful in this role you have several years of experience from a similar role with good knowledge from the Microsoft environment. You have a technical university degree including programming, or equivalent, and are fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.
 


 Required competencies:
 * Deep knowledge (min 3+ years) of C#, .NET and Azure (portal, service bus and DevOps).
* Knowledge and a strong understanding of SQL, Cosmos, databases, APIs.
* Strong experience with modern development technologies.
* CQRS design pattern.
* Experience in building scalable and secure applications by working methodically.
* Microservice architecture.
* Blazor.



 As a person you are a skilled communicator who collaborates well with both colleagues and customers. You are a team player who appreciates and values your colleagues’ competencies, and you find motivation in learning from each other to grow as a team.
 


 Practical information:
 
 Start date: As soon as possible
 



 Scope: Full time, 40h/week
 



 Salary: Fixed salary based on competence and experience
 



 Placement: Täby, Stockholm. With the possibility to work from home
 



 Other benefits: Wellness allowance, 30 days vacation, occupational pension
 


 Interested?
 
 If you’re ready to take the next step in your career and want to join a company that values innovation, collaboration, and technical excellence, send in your application today! We look forward to hearing from you and discussing how you can contribute to our team and projects.
 



 Send in CV and application to michael.lundstig@strongpoint.com with the hopes of becoming part of our successful team in Täby!

title: Tech Lead with Machine Learning Expertise
description:
**About All Ears** 




 All Ears is a global leader in audio and new media monitoring, offering an AI-based SaaS solution that analyzes brands and trends in voice and video in real-time. Our superior coverage spans television, radio, podcasts, YouTube, and TikTok. With nearly 1000 customers across the Nordics, EU, and US, our clients include Walmart, Pfizer, Volvo, and KFC.
 



  





 Founded in 2016 with CTO Håkan Waara as a co-founder, All Ears is backed by investors like Bonnier Capital and Alfvén & Didrikson. Recently featured in “Deloitte Sweden Technology Fast 50 - 2023” and Breakit’s “Sweden's 35 most promising AI startups,” we have significantly strengthened our senior management and board of directors.
 



  





 In 2023, All Ears crossed the 40 million mark in ARR and has been profitable since January 2024, maintaining a solid cash position. We are now focusing on growth by enhancing our product and user experience, expanding into new languages and markets, and broadening our commercial approach. 🚀
 



  





**About the role** 




 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced
 **Tech Lead** 
 with extensive experience in
 **Machine Learning and/or Natural Language Processing** 
 to join our dynamic team. This role is pivotal as it combines both technical development and leadership responsibilities. As the Tech Lead you will be playing a crucial role in scaling our tech team, managing complex technical projects, and driving the success of our tech development across multiple markets.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Collaborate closely with the CTO to set the technical vision and strategy for the company.
* Lead, mentor, and develop a team of software engineers, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
* Use state of the art machine learning, NLP and AI to extract insights from our unique data.
* Oversee the implementation of NLP techniques to extract meaningful insights from our data.
* Work with data scientists and engineers to analyze and interpret complex data sets.
* Drive innovation in data analysis and AI, incorporating the latest industry advancements.
* Ensure best practices in data processing, model training, testing, and documentation.
* Drive the expansion of our tech team, including hiring, onboarding, and retaining top talent.
* Address and manage complex technical challenges as our company grows, including expanding into new markets and diversifying our product offerings.
* Work with cross-functional teams, including product management, sales, and marketing, to align technical initiatives with business goals.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies, incorporating relevant advancements into our technology stack.
* Ensure best practices in software development, including code reviews, testing, and documentation.
* Report directly to the CTO and provide regular updates on project status, team performance, and technical challenges.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Deep knowledge of text analysis, NLP, Machine Learning
* Proven experience in a technical leadership role, preferably from a tech/product company.
* Strong background in software development, with proficiency in one or more programming languages
* Demonstrated experience in scaling tech teams and managing complex technical projects.
* Deep understanding of software architecture, cloud computing, and modern development practices.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to make sound technical decisions in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.
* Experience with agile methodologies and project management tools.
* Previous experience with audio and new media technologies is a plus.



  





**Meritorious Experience:** 



* Proven track record of scaling tech teams in terms of personnel and addressing more complex technical situations.
* LLM integration experience
* Experience with Python, React, Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL, distributed systems
* Experience in scaling and performance challenges



  





**Ready to join the team?** 




 Amazing! Apply by using your LinkedIn profile (or upload a resume) and answer a few click-in questions. We'd love to get to know you and understand what makes you tick, so feel free to add a sentence about what you enjoy about your role and what would be an exciting challenge for you going forward. Be yourself and let that shine through in your application!
 



  





*All Ears is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.* 




  





*Please note that we do not accept any applications through email due to GDPR.*

title: Senior ML HW modelling engineer
description:
**Job Overview:**  

We have a fantastic opportunity to move into Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence, key technologies for the future of computing. Working on the cutting edge of Arm IP, crafting technology that powers the next generation of mobile apps, portable devices, home automation, smart cities, self-driving cars, and much more!
  
Arm is entering a new growth phase to develop innovative technologies and products for existing and new markets. To do this we need hardworking and motivated people to join our team. Working with the world’s best companies as they build sector-leading products from our designs. You’ll share ideas with and learn new skills from the best engineers in the world. We work in small teams, so your contributions will make a difference. This role offers the opportunity to lead, challenge the status quo and ultimately change the world of ML and AI!
  
Responsibilities
  
The team in Lund is responsible for machine learning hardware and software IP.
  
Our next generation NPU development starts in the HW modelling platform and as a senior HW Modelling engineer, you will work/develop/design/architect new features and evaluate their performance. You will be working closely with the ML HW design and verification teams to contribute to the design, specification, and verification of the product. You will also be assisting the compiler team to ensure the HW is run at optimal performance and supporting the model as an external deliverable in customer engagements. As a senior engineer you are expected to be able to take lead on larger work-packages and to mentor more junior engineers.
  
  

We are looking for someone with a strong analytical skills, eagerness to find innovative solutions to complex problems, who like to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment where you cooperate closely in a diverse team of colleagues, together striving to fulfil common targets.
  
  

For a sneak peek of ARM Lund, please have a look at the following video: http://bit.ly/2kxWMXp
  
  

**Required Skills and Experience :**  

Master’s or PhD degree in Machine learning, Electrical Engineering, Engineering Physics, Computer Science, or similar technical field.
  
Experienced in HW design and/or modelling
  
Strong programming skills (C, C++, Python)
  
  

**“Nice To Have” Skills and Experience :**  

Experienced in SystemC and HLS flows
  
Source control skills (Git, Gerrit, Repo)
  
Worked and developed using methods like agile SW development, continuous integration and Test driven development.
  
Experience with Machine Learning applications and frameworks
  
Some experience in compiler development
  
Sound understanding of signal processing, control system.

title: Computer Vision Engineer / Advanced Content Creation
company: Sony Nordic (Sweden), Filial Till Sony Europe B.
description:
**The role’s main task will center around:**  

Develop Computer Vision (CV) related tools and solutions for creating and maintaining large-scale interactive experiences combining Sony IP and technology.
  
Create tools to easily setup and maintain the Computer Vision (CV) related capture and tracking solutions in both temporary and permanent installations.
  
Work closely with members in Tokyo and Lund to improve Computer Vision-based solutions such as internal markerless body tracking solutions or volumetric capture solutions and adjust them for the team’s specific use cases within Location-Based Entertainment.
  
  

**Main responsibilities:****Markerless body tracking solutions:**  

* Improve proprietary markerless body tracking solutions.
* Adapt solutions for Location-Based Entertainment (LBE) use cases.
* Develop tools for easy setup, as well as maintain and evaluate the tracking systems in both temporary and permanent installations.


**Communication and coordination:**  

* Act as the main point of contact for CV inquiries and requests.
* Regularly share updates on progress with colleagues in Japan.
* Stay informed about the latest developments of internal CV related solutions (SEC/ BIPF).


**System testing and stability:**  

* Ensure compatibility of tracking systems with core technologies used within the LBE SDK.
* Frequently test tracking solutions to ensure stability.
* Write and execute test cases for new software versions.
* Install and configure software on various systems.


**Hardware and software integration:**  

* Investigate hardware improvements related to tracking solutions.
* Develop or modify software to support the in-house 3D pose estimation software as needed.


**Client interaction and project support:**  

* Understand the system thoroughly to evaluate client requirements and determine feasibility.
* Implement functions to support new project needs and integrate them into the 3D pose estimation software.


Your new office
  
Sony in Lund is a place where technology, creativity and boldness create a better future – for Sony, for our customers and for society. We have expertise in Research, Software Development, and Design, contributing to Sony Group. Sony in Lund has a long history of innovation and is the home of the Sony Start-up Acceleration Program Europe. Here in the Lund office you will find a collaborative, friendly and inclusive atmosphere, and colleagues from all over the world.
  
  

Life at Sony
  
We ensure competitive salaries and benefits by using established benchmarking. We encourage healthy work-life balance supported by hybrid and flexible working policies. We are a positive community who dream big together, respect each other, and enjoy a collaborative culture.
  
  

We like to celebrate our colleagues who make a real difference using our recognition platform. We also provide access to numerous services and platforms for all aspects of wellbeing. We listen to our people through conversations and surveys, respect their suggestions, then act on them. We also provide allowances for volunteering days so that our staff can support the causes they are most passionate about.
  
  

You can build your career around you with our fantastic range of learning & personal development programs to enhance your skills. We also encourage our staff to try exciting new roles, in a wide range of countries, with a supportive mobility team to support you if you take that leap!
  
  

Bring your uniqueness to Sony
  
We are passionate about creating a culture that promotes equity and cultivates inclusion, diversity, and belonging. We want employees with diverse backgrounds and perspectives that will stimulate innovation and have a direct impact on our creation of social value to fulfil Sony’s purpose – ‘to fill the world with emotion, through the power of creativity and technology’. We want you to bring your unique self to work and help shape our culture.
  
  

We are Sony Europe
  
Our people collaborate in an environment of respect, integrity, and open-mindedness. Diverse teams from all over Europe are the driving force for our business, and we embrace the differences that make each of us original and unique.
  
  

With offices in 28 European countries, Sony Europe caters to consumer, professional, semiconductor and healthcare markets with innovative electronics products and solutions. Our European laboratories research and develop new technologies and capabilities that contributes to the Sony Group and important issues on a planetary scale.
  
  

Bring your passion, creativity and ambitions to Sony Europe. Apply now, and let’s create the future together.
  
Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: QA Automation Engineer
description:
The multi-screen streaming video and the interactive TV space is growing rapidly. Accedo delivers rich media apps on multiple platforms ranging from Smart TVs, gaming consoles, Set Top Boxes, Roku, Apple TV, Android TV, Chromecast, Web, Smart phones, tablets and more. Accedo is a leading company in this sector and is hiring at multiple locations (Madrid, Stockholm, London, Guadalajara, Budapest).


At Accedo, you will be part of a diverse and multi-disciplined development team, gaining exposure to cutting-edge technologies. This means working with some of the largest global media brands in the industry, e.g. Netflix, Spotify, BBC, HBO and Deutsche Telekom, just to name a few. Working in a highly collaborative and international environment, you will help transform requirements and designs into high performing feature rich applications on a wide variety of web based platforms and devices.

**Who are we?**


We are Accedo and have more than ten years of experience helping hundreds of TV platform operators, broadcasters, media companies, and consumer electronics manufacturers across the globe to design, deliver and manage the next generation video user experience across a vast range of connected devices.


Accedo offers a truly global working environment, with offices all over the world, including Stockholm, London, New York, Silicon Valley, Sydney, Hong Kong, Guadalajara, Toronto and more.


At the end of the day, our employees are what make us who we are, which means we work hard to create a good working environment with plenty of opportunities to grow and develop within Accedo, wherever they want to be in the world.
