We are on a journey, and are always open to ideas and individuals that want to contribute to making that journey a success.


This position is aimed at Accedo's growing Quality Assurance Engineering team in **Stockholm**. At Accedo you will be part of a diverse and multi-disciplined team, gain exposure to cutting edge technologies and can work with some of the largest global media brands in the industry. Working in a highly collaborative environment, you will help transforming requirements and designs into high performing and feature rich applications on a wide variety of web based platforms and devices.

**What you will do:**

* Design, develop, execute and maintain test scripts on Big Screen devices, STBs, mobile or web by leveraging coding skills and designated automation tools/frameworks
* Ensure test coverage meets overall system and software requirements
* Collaborate with internal and external teams, the team members will play a key role in software quality assurance of solutions that will be deployed in products worldwide.
* Testing and automation will range from validation of the user interface to sometimes low level validation of media streaming and broadcast technologies.
* Perform functional testing of new features and changes, and regression testing on releases, third party changes
* Addressing bugs & defects found during the development cycle.
* Deploy artefacts to different product environments (i.e. development, QA, UAT…), in apps.
* Interact with cross-functional scrum team, including product owners, designers, developers as well as other internal or external stakeholders, by example, joining sprint planning meetings, backlog refinements and sprint retrospectives to ensure the app quality meets specified functional, performance and business requirements
* Proactive communication with key stakeholders
* Provide task estimations
* Help to replicate hard to reproduce issues. Provide a clear and accurate description of each bug found. Track production issues and continuously identify high risk areas to improve test coverage.
* Write and maintain manual and automated test artefacts for the product.
* Collaborate with scrum teams to improve testing coverage, efficiency.

  

Requirements:  

﻿  

**What we are looking for**

* 2+ years of hands on test automation experience
* Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT (or related discipline), or equivalent working experience.
* Solid understanding of software development methodologies and concepts, like Agile/Scrum, Waterfall, Continuous Delivery, Test Driven Development.
* Programming knowledge: Javascript. This is a mandatory requirement.
* Preferred - Selenium, Appium automation experience
* Basic experience integrating open source or 3rd party APIs and Libraries.
* Ability to work independently, with guidance from Senior Engineers
* Excellent problem solving skills and passion for technical challenges.
* Interested and eager to dive into new technology areas and immerse in topics relevant to the business.
* Good written and verbal communication skills in English.
* Knowledge of platform specific languages, frameworks and tools.
* Knowledge of software development fundamentals (data structures, algorithms...).
* Great analytical thinking skills
* Experience automating test cases on Connected TVs, android tvs, Set Top Boxes is a plus

**What We Offer**

* Competitive salary and benefits
* Yearly training budget - which can be spent on IT conferences or online trainings
* Nice, spacious office located in central Stockholm/Budapest/Madrid/London
* Hybrid working model with a flexibility to work from home
* Opportunity to participate in a range of company events
* Autonomy and a fantastic working culture

  

Country:
  

Sweden

title: Production Test Technical Lead
description:
We are looking for a Production test technical lead to our growing R&D organization!
  
Acconeer is a scale-up company where you get the opportunity to be at the frontline of miniaturized technology, integrating a complete 60GHz radar system in a package as small as 5x5mm! The Acconeer ASIC production test team operates in a versatile work environment together with Operations team, other R&D teams, and external test solution providers. We are currently looking for an engineer with at least a couple of years´ work experience within ASIC or module production test software, data analysis, and test system setup, to lead the technical work at Acconeer.
  
Our ASIC team consists of both senior experts and newly graduates where everyone has a chance to excel in things they do very well, but also to learn new areas they haven´t tried before. Within Acconeer ASIC production test we develop state-of-the-art production test solutions for mmWave antenna-in-package designs. Our technology is novel, both in product features and how it is tested in production. This requires that you have an innovative mindset to find solutions that can contribute to optimizing cost of the product while ensuring Automotive grade quality. As a Production Test Technical Lead you will contribute to the development and qualification of the test hardware and software, as well as to the failure analysis and yield analysis processes.
  
The ideal candidate should have previous experience of ASIC production test and a hands-on problem-solving approach. You should lead the execution of ASIC production test by setting a good example and engage the team to achieve intermediate goals, to be result oriented and to meet customer commitment. This requires that you have good project planning skills, focus on delivering, a structured way of working and that you can prioritize when needed. Fluency in C or Python will also be highly valued. If this sounds like you, and you can back it up with a Bachelor or Master of Science degree, we would love to hear from you.
  
As we expand the ASIC department, we value persons with insights in development methodology, quality, and a structured way of working. But the most important thing is that you are eager to learn and want to contribute to the positive, friendly atmosphere in the company.
  
About Acconeer
  
Acconeer is a young and innovative company developing the world´s smallest 60 GHz radar. The Acconeer radar sensor combines extremely low power consumption with sub-mm distance estimation accuracy. It enables distance measurements, micro-motion detection, material classification and much more, all within a sensor sized 5×5 mm including antennas. Acconeer is located in Västra Hamnen, Malmö, Sweden. We are currently a group of around 60 people with high R&D focus, working closely together over the R&D disciplines – hardware, software, and algorithm research. We have a large and growing international customer base in the IoT, consumer electronics, industrial and automotive segments which means our sensors are integrated in everything from robotic lawn mowers and touchless buttons to industrial tank-level gauges and parking sensors for smart cities.
  
Working at Acconeer
  
We love working in a scaleup where we have real possibilities to influence both the product and how we work. As we are a small company with open–minded employees it is always easy to discuss with people outside your team to satisfy your appetite for knowledge. We get to work with cutting edge technology in close collaboration with our colleagues. We believe that people are most efficient when we are allowed to plan our work life in a way that suits our individual needs and circumstances. So even though we all have our personal desk in our lovely office, working from home is a natural part of our way of working at Acconeer. If you feel the same way about teamwork and amazing technology, we’d love to meet you! For questions, contact recruiting manager Jordan Rydell at +46 (0)10 218 92 00.
  
Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Software Engineer C/C#
description:
**We are looking for a Software Engineer to join our Product Development team in Stockholm. Are you an experienced software engineer with proficiency in C as well as in C#, and want to work in the frontline of machine learning for edge devices? Then this position might be something for you.** 




  





 See our product in action here:
 




 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-XhbvlWcymY&t=1228s&ab\_channel=tinyML
 




  





**About Imagimob** 




 Imagimob is a fast growing startup driving innovation at the forefront of Edge AI and tinyML—and enabling the intelligent products of the future. Based in Stockholm, Sweden, the company has been serving global customers within the automotive, manufacturing, healthcare, and lifestyle industries since 2013. In 2020, Imagimob launched their SaaS Imagimob Studio for the swift and easy end-to-end development of Edge AI applications for devices with constrained resources.
 



  





 In May 2023, Infineon Technologies AG acquired 100% of the shares in Imagimob. Imagimob belongs to the Connected Secure Systems (CSS) division.
 



  





 Demonstration of in-ear headphones, using software developed within our Studio:
 




 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZTyJz3yCjiM
 








 Today we are a team of 17 employees, divided into three teams: Sales & Marketing, Product Development and Customer Success.
 



  





**About the position** 




 Working with us you will get the opportunity to become part of our skilled product development team with creative and innovative Software Engineers and ML researchers, shaping the future of Edge AI. Your focus will be on improving our model deployment pipeline, which is part of our machine learning development platform, used by our customers to build state-of-the art ML applications for embedded devices.
 



  





 You will be responsible for the integration of our neural network deployment pipeline into Imagimob Studio. This involves working together with our embedded software engineers to enable optimised signal processing, neural network operator acceleration, and support for new MCUs, NPUs (neural processing units) and sensors within the platform.
 



 You will be part of implementing new functionality and will think hard about how to further develop a unique and innovative platform and shorten its development life-cycle.
 



 Since we are a small product team, your work will have a big impact on the products that we ship.
 



  





**What you will do…** 



* Work together with experienced software engineers to advance Imagimob Studio’s ability to output ever-more optimised code
* Implement new features related to ML model deployment and verification on hardware
* Improve and extend our capability to stream data, ML model output and debug diagnostics live from embedded devices
* Board bring-up of exciting cutting edge hardware containing the latest embedded ML accelerators
* Write high quality software together with other skilled software engineers
* Think deeply about, and be part of shaping the future of the area of Edge AI/tinyML, where Imagimob is recognised as a global leader
* You will get to work more with implementing new features and improving existing ones, rather than maintenance



  





**We need someone who has...** 



* Minimum 3 years of relevant, post-graduate, full time, experience
* Proficiency in both C and C# as you will integrate our NN code generation toolchain (C application) with Imagimob Studio (C# application)
* Experience in writing and shipping high quality code
* Ownership and go-get attitude
* Good collaboration abilities
* University degree or equivalent experience in computer science, electrical engineering, engineering physics or similar



  





**It’s an extra bonus if you have…** 



* C++ experience
* Some WPF experience
* Some Python programming experience
* Some proficiency in one or more machine learning frameworks
* Interesting side projects



  





**We offer you...** 



* The opportunity to further develop our development platform, responsible for bringing deep learning to the edge, where we are recognised as a leader in our field
* Being part of an excellent international team with highly motivated individuals striving for a common goal
* A chance to be part of solving real world problems using ML
* Competitive salary, wellness allowance, and possibility to attend online-courses during working hours
* An open-minded and unpretentious company culture
* Opportunities to grow with the company and advance your career
* Short decision paths, we love getting things done
* An office in central Stockholm and the flexibility of working from home



  





 Are you the person we described above? Then click apply!
 



  





 If you have any questions about the role, please contact zoe.lepluart@ninox-limited.com.
 



  





***\*\*NOTE: We go through the selection continuously, but it may take a little longer than usual due to summer period.\*\****

title: Junior Android Engineer, Core Experience
description:
We are looking for a Junior Android Engineer to join the Core Experience team, responsible for experiences in our main iOS and Android applications.
   

  

 As part of the team, you will get the chance to provide platform components to serve our internal customers as well as delivering user facing experiences to consumers. This is a highly impactful role where you and the rest of the team will impact the way the world experiences audio!
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Collaborate with a small, autonomous team of developers, designers, and product owners to find end-to-end solutions to important problems
* Implement these solutions for our Android client, adhering to Android development best practices
* Help your team solve problems in a way that makes sense for Android users and our codebase
* Join dozens of other developers and help to shape the direction of Android development at Spotify


 Who You Are
   

  

* You hold a degree in computer science or similar subject and have at least 1+ years of working experience in a similar android engineering position
* You have an understanding of Android development
* Previous coding experience in object-oriented Kotlin
* You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high-quality code
* You have some knowledge of distributed systems, and be passionate about pairing programming practices and agile technologies
* You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills


 Where You’ll Be
   

  

* For this role you will be based in Stockholm, Sweden


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**About Kambi**
 Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.
   

  

 Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.
   

  

**About Tzeract:**
 Tzeract is a pioneering sports betting AI pricing company, operating as an agile startup within the larger ecosystem of Kambi Group ( https://kambi.com/ ). Our mission is to revolutionize the sports betting industry by leveraging cutting-edge technology and advanced analytics to enable the next generation of sports betting experiences. With a focus on both historical and real-time sports data, we're building systems that outperform the market and deliver value to our users.
   

  

 To know more about us - https://tzeract.com/
   

  

**Role Overview:**
 We're seeking a skilled
 **Data Engineer** 
 with a passion for sports and a keen eye for statistics to join our dynamic team. This role is pivotal in designing, building, and maintaining our data infrastructure, ensuring the seamless flow and integrity of large-scale sports data sets. You will work closely with our data scientists and developers, turning complex data into actionable insights that drive our AI algorithms.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Develop and maintain scalable and robust data pipelines for real-time and historical sports data ingestion, processing, and analysis using Python and AWS services.
* Implement and manage AWS cloud-based solutions to ensure high availability, performance, and security of our data infrastructure.
* Collaborate with data scientists to understand data requirements for AI model development and provide the necessary data engineering support.
* Apply your expertise in statistics and data analysis to enhance data quality and the effectiveness of our AI algorithms.
* Monitor data pipelines and systems performance, troubleshoot data issues, and implement optimizations.
* Stay updated with the latest technologies and methodologies in data engineering and sports analytics to continuously improve our data systems.


**Qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
* 3+ years of experience in data engineering, with a strong proficiency in Python.
* Extensive experience with AWS services (e.g., S3, EC2, RDS, Lambda, Redshift) and managing cloud-based data infrastructure.
* Solid understanding of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing principles.
* Experience with real-time data processing and streaming technologies is highly desirable.
* A good eye for statistics and experience in statistical modeling or analysis.
* Passion for sports and sports data analysis is a big plus.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced startup environment.


**Why Join Us:**
* Be part of a cutting-edge project that's shaping the future of sports betting.
* Work in an environment that values innovation, collaboration, and a data-driven approach.
* Enjoy a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and flexible working arrangements.
* Engage in continuous learning and growth opportunities within an ambitious tech startup.


**How to Apply:**
 Send your resume, a brief cover letter explaining why you're a good fit for this role, and any relevant portfolio links or GitHub repository to us. Please include "Data Engineer Application" in the subject line.
   

  

 We're excited to hear from you and explore how you can contribute to our team!
   

  

 #wearekambi
   

  

**Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace**
 If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.
   

  

**Creating an inclusive environment**
 We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.
   

  

 #wearekambi

title: Senior Backend Developer
description:
Kundo är ett SaaS-bolag som erbjuder Nordens mest okrångliga kundservicelösning. Kundservice är en bransch i snabb förändring där ny teknik/AI har medfört stora möjligheter till innovation och effektivisering. Det innebär att vi har en spännande resa framför oss där vår produkt både ska byggas ut men också transformeras för att möta nya behov och de möjligheter som finns med AI.
 



 På vår fortsatta tillväxtresa letar vi efter dig som vill ansluta till vårt fantastiska produktutvecklingsteam som backend-utvecklare med kunskap och intresse för infrastruktur och drift.
 



 Denna roll kommer att bidra till att framtidssäkra vår plattform och möjliggöra våra AI-drivna initiativ, delta i utvecklingsprojekt, samt vidareutveckla och underhålla vår skalbar cloud-arkitektur och hantering av säkerhetslösningar. För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du har:
 



  




* Minst 5 år erfarenhet av webbutveckling
* Bred erfarenhet av produktutveckling i Python
* Djup kunskap av AWS infrastruktur och Infrastructure as code
* Känner dig trygg gällande DevOps praxis och har praktisk erfarenhet av mjukvaru-releaser (helst continous deployment)



  





**Om vår produkt** 




 Med vår produkt får våra kunder ett modernt och kraftfullt kundserviceverktyg att samarbeta i för att svara på alla ärenden som de får in. Med hjälp av vår produkt levererar organisationer i Norden en bättre kundserviceupplevelse till tiotusentals kunder varje dag.
 



 Flera miljoner meddelanden passerar genom våra system varje månad - och den siffran ökar hela tiden. Enkelheten i att använda våra tjänster är mycket uppskattat av våra kunder och något vi är stolta över.
 



 Undrar du vilka tekniker vi arbetar med? Här är de tekniker du kommer att arbeta med:
 



  




* Python - Django/FastAPI
* AWS (Kostnadsoptimering, Nätverk, IAM)
* Kubernetes
* Terraform
* MySQL
* Elastic Search



  





**Vad kan vi erbjuda dig?** 



* Små team med täta samarbeten inom och utanför teamet
* Högt lärande och delaktighet i alla delar av produktutvecklingen
* Goda förmåner som ett 32 dagars semester, kollektivavtal, friskvårdsbidrag på 5000 kr/år, pension (ITP-1) och privatvårdsförsäkring
* Hybrid-upplägg som möjliggör remotearbete 2 dagar/vecka
* Konferensresa varje höst, roliga teamaktiviteter och interna events, sommarfest och julbord, etc



  





 Har du några frågor? Vi berättar gärna mer! Hör av dig till Jonatan Larsson på 070-5124424 eller jonatan@kundo.se. Till denna tjänst tar vi ingen hjälp av partners, utan kommer att sköta processerna på egen hand internt.

title: Lead Software Architect
description:
Barnebys Group AB is the world’s leading ecosystem for art, antiques, and collectibles throughout the value chain. Founded in Stockholm, Sweden in 2011, we have established our business globally with offices in the US, UK, France, Spain, and Germany. Our clients include the world’s top tier of auctioneers, antique dealers, galleries, as well as regional and local businesses. We offer a search service with over 600,000 items for sale, an extensive database of auction results, a top-of-the-line valuation service, and a white-label auction and gallery system. We are committed to making antiques and collectibles accessible to everyone. We are now looking to grow our business even further and are seeking top talent to join our team.
 



  





 We are looking for a
 **Lead Software Architect** 
 to design highly performant, scalable solutions for our SaaS applications and to guide our development teams in achieving technical excellence.
 



  





**What You’ll Be Doing:** 



* **Own and Drive Architecture:** 
 Take ownership of the architecture, ensuring proactive planning and design of high-performance solutions that enable and support our business objectives.
* **Active Coding:** 
 Be actively involved in writing, reviewing, and optimising code alongside the team to ensure high standards and best practices.
* **Leadership:** 
 Act as a technical mentor and coach, guiding teams in writing high-quality, testable code, and fostering a culture of excellence.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** 
 Work within a cross-functional team to deliver premium experiences to our users and experts globally.
* **Agile Processes:** 
 Promote and reinforce the importance of agile processes within the team, ensuring smooth and efficient workflow.
* **Backend Development:** 
 Design, develop, and deploy backend services focusing on high availability, low latency, and scalability.
* **Innovation and Improvement:** 
 Continuously monitor, test, and optimise designs to ensure the highest standards of performance and reliability.
* **Strategic Advisor:** 
 Act as a sounding board providing strategic insights to ensure cohesive and comprehensive solutions across the organisation.



  





**Who You Are:** 



* **Experienced and Knowledgeable:** 
 Proven experience with cloud platforms such as GCP, AWS, and Azure, and a deep understanding of databases and architectural patterns. You have a track record of building multi-tenant systems.
* **Full-Stack Awareness:** 
 You have a strong understanding of frontend technologies like React and Next.js, enabling you to ensure seamless integration and collaboration between backend and frontend development.
* **Excellent Communicator:** 
 Strong communication skills in both Swedish and English, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts clearly.
* **Curious and Open-Minded:** 
 Open to different perspectives, leading with curiosity, humility, and a strong coaching mindset.
* **Business-Savvy:** 
 Understand the importance of your work in providing value to others and appreciate the balance between technical and business decisions.
* **Agile Understanding:** 
 You have a good understanding of the principles of flow optimization, relative estimation, and reflective practices within agile frameworks, and recognize their importance in improving team efficiency and product quality.
* **Team Player:** 
 Recognize the strength of a well-communicated, self-organised team in an agile environment.
* **Domain Experience:** 
 Experience in the auction or e-commerce domain is a plus.
* **Sound Engineering Practices:** 
 Passionate about sound engineering practices and continuously improving your skills.



  





**Bonus:** 



* Knowledge about finance and accounting systems

title: Solutions Field Application Engineer
description:
****Position:****
 Solutions Field Application Engineer
   

  

****Job Description:****
 We are looking for an individual, who is passionate about electronics, innovative and enjoy being involved in technology projects that will make life not only different, but better. If you are energetic, self-driven, have great social skills and have experience with electronics design there is no doubt that we have something exciting to offer you. Join our company in an exciting job as Solution Field Application Engineer where no two days are the same. As the expert you will be delivering the best level of engineering services and solutions in this region by providing strong technical expertise in the electronic components sector. Our customers need you to guide them on the latest technologies to make their inventions and products the best in the world!
   

  

**What Will You Do?**
* Serve as a guiding force for creative inventors, enabling the realization of their groundbreaking ideas and products.
* Forge and nurture trust-based relationships with Electronic R&D departments across our client base in Sweden, primarily focusing on the Stockholm region.
* Advise development engineers on selecting cutting-edge electronic components and technologies for their upcoming designs.
* Engage in continuous professional development, benefiting from the latest training offered by leading electronic component manufacturers and our in-house specialists.
* Immerse yourself in diverse and thrilling development projects, making every day unique.


**Who Are We Looking For?**
* A seasoned professional with a Electronics Engineering degree, or equivalent, bringing 2-3 years of experience ideally gained within the components or electronics industry.
* A background working with customer or supplier companies, with a solid understanding of the business side of technology.
* Fluency in Swedish & English is a must, with a preference for candidates residing in or willing to relocate to the Stockholm area, ready for a hybrid work model.
* Availability for frequent business travel, including 2-3 days a week within Sweden and 10-20 days a year internationally.


**What's in It for You?**
* Comprehensive training on the latest technologies in the electronic industry, ensuring you're always ahead.
* A permanent contract with a competitive base salary plus a bonus scheme, reflecting your invaluable contribution to our success.
* A company car or car allowance, supporting your mobility.
* The chance to collaborate with a broad array of companies and immerse yourself in technologies driving the next wave of innovation.


**Our story**
 As Arrow Global Components (AGC), a part of Arrow Electronics, we are a leader in distribution and value-added services related to electronic components. We resell, customize, and distribute electronic components to our clients all over the world. Our business is based on a trusted, long-lasting net of relationships with industry leaders, both on the supplier and customer side.
   

  

 Arrow is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or disability status.
   

  

 EMEA Interview Preparation | Arrow Electronics
   

  

****Location:****
 SE-Kista, Sweden (Kronborgsgränd)
   

  

****Time Type:****
 Full time
   

  

****Job Category:****
 Sales

title: WordPressutvecklare till Webbyrån Generation (backend alt. fullstack)
description:
WordPressutvecklare till Webbyrån Generation (backend / fullstack)
 
  





 Är du en passionerad WordPressutvecklare som letar efter nästa spännande utmaning? Vill du vara en del av en av Sveriges mest etablerade webbyråer med fokus på WordPress? Då kan du vara den vi söker! Hos oss på Generation får du chansen att arbeta med några Sveriges största varumärken och organisationer.
   




 Kort om oss
 
  





 Generation är en ledande webbyrå med drygt 20 medarbetare, specialiserade på WordPress. Vi har vårt huvudkontor på S:t Eriksgatan 121b i Stockholm, men erbjuder även möjligheten att arbeta hybrid i vissa roller. Våra kunder är ofta större bolag och varumärken som behöver professionell design, utveckling, drift och support av sina webbplatser. Några exempel är Storytel, Tradera, Handelsbanken, Budbee, Svenska spel och Åbro. Vi förvaltar över 500 sajter och har en stark närvaro i branschen sedan tio år tillbaka.
 



  





 Här får du stabila arbetsvillkor kombinerat med en ung, driven kultur och familjär stämning. Vi tror på schyssta värderingar och sunt förnuft i en miljö där både medarbetare och företaget kan växa och frodas tillsammans.
 



  




 Arbetsuppgifter
 
  





 Som WordPressutvecklare hos oss kommer du att:
 



  




* Utveckla och underhålla WordPress-plugins och teman
* Arbeta med PHP, HTML, CSS och JavaScript
* Använda Git för versionshantering
* Hantera SSH och bash för serveradministration
* Samarbeta med våra kunder och team för att leverera högkvalitativa lösningar



  




 Kvalifikationer
   

 Måste ha
 
  




* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av WordPress-utveckling
* Goda kunskaper i PHP, HTML, CSS och JavaScript
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla WordPress-plugins och teman
* Kunskap i Git och SSH/bash
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift (på grund av kundkrav)
* Engelska i tal och skrift



  




 Meriterande
 
  




* Erfarenhet av Laravel, VueJS, Node och NPM för build-verktyg
* Tidigare erfarenhet av kundkontakt
* Serveradministration



  





  




 PraktisktAllmänt
 
  




* **Start:** 
 Snarast, eller enligt överenskommelse
* **Plats:** 
 Huvudkontoret på S:t Eriksgatan 121b i Stockholm eller möjlighet att jobba delvis på distans
* **Arbetstid:** 
  Flex, 40h/vecka
* **Anställningsform:** 
 Provanställning, sedan tillsvidareanställning med fast månadslön



  




 Förmåner
 
  




* Pension
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Halvdag innan röd dag
* Sjukförsäkring med rehabiliteringsstöd
* TFA (Trygghetsförsäkring vid arbetsskada)
* TGL (Tjänstegrupplivförsäkring)
* Macbook Pro



  




 Ansökan
 
  





 Ansökningar hanteras löpande. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan och att få välkomna dig till vårt team på Generation.
 



  





 Läs mer och sök här:
 



 https://thegeneration.onecruiter.com/jobs/277502-wordpressutvecklare-till-webbyran-generation
